text: Elderly man with sudden onset of severe chest pain radiating to the left arm, diaphoresis, and nausea. ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads V2-V4. Diagnosis: anterior STEMI.
label: cardiology

text: Teenager with clusters of vesicles on the lips, preceded by tingling and burning. Lesions resolve with crusting. Diagnosis: herpes labialis.
label: dermatology

text: Woman with progressive fatigue, cold intolerance, and constipation. Physical exam reveals dry skin and bradycardia. Labs show elevated TSH and low free T4. Diagnosis: primary hypothyroidism.
label: endocrinology

text: Young adult with crampy abdominal pain, weight loss, and non-bloody diarrhea. Colonoscopy reveals skip lesions and cobblestoning. Diagnosis: Crohn's disease.
label: gastroenterology

text: Older adult with persistent bone pain, anemia, and hypercalcemia. Serum protein electrophoresis shows M-spike. Diagnosis: multiple myeloma.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Traveler returns from Africa with high fever, chills, and jaundice. Blood smear shows ring forms in erythrocytes. Diagnosis: malaria.
label: infectious_disease

text: Elderly man with long-standing hypertension presents with progressive lower extremity edema, nocturia, and frothy urine. Labs show elevated creatinine and proteinuria. Diagnosis: nephrotic syndrome.
label: nephrology

text: Middle-aged man presents with sudden onset of right-sided weakness, facial droop, and aphasia. CT scan shows left MCA infarct. Diagnosis: acute ischemic stroke.
label: neurology

text: Pregnant woman at 10 weeks presents with vaginal bleeding and mild lower abdominal pain. Ultrasound shows viable intrauterine pregnancy. Diagnosis: threatened miscarriage.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Young adult with eye pain, photophobia, and blurred vision. Slit lamp exam shows hypopyon and ciliary flush. Diagnosis: anterior uveitis.
label: ophthalmology

text: Athlete presents with acute knee pain after pivoting injury. Exam reveals joint effusion and positive Lachman test. MRI confirms ACL tear. Diagnosis: anterior cruciate ligament rupture.
label: orthopedics

text: Child presents with sore throat, drooling, and muffled voice. Exam reveals inspiratory stridor and sitting in tripod position. Diagnosis: acute epiglottitis.
label: otolaryngology

text: Young woman with persistent sadness, anhedonia, and insomnia for 2 months. No psychotic symptoms. Diagnosis: major depressive disorder.
label: psychiatry

text: Middle-aged man with progressive shortness of breath, chronic productive cough, and barrel-shaped chest. Spirometry shows FEV1/FVC < 70%. Diagnosis: COPD.
label: pulmonology

text: Woman with symmetric joint pain, morning stiffness lasting >1 hour, and swelling of MCP and PIP joints. Labs show positive rheumatoid factor and anti-CCP. Diagnosis: rheumatoid arthritis.
label: rheumatology

text: Patient presents with chest pain and elevated troponin. ECG shows ST-segment elevation. Diagnosis: acute myocardial infarction.
label: cardiology

text: Patient has itchy, erythematous plaques on elbows and knees. Diagnosis: chronic plaque psoriasis.
label: dermatology

text: Patient reports fatigue and weight gain. Lab results show elevated TSH and low T4. Diagnosis: hypothyroidism.
label: endocrinology

text: Patient complains of abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea. Colonoscopy reveals ulcerative colitis.
label: gastroenterology

text: Patient presents with fatigue and pallor. Blood smear shows blasts. Diagnosis: acute myeloid leukemia.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Patient has fever, cough, and positive PCR for influenza A. Diagnosis: viral respiratory infection.
label: infectious_disease

text: Patient with hypertension and proteinuria. Lab results show decreased GFR. Diagnosis: chronic kidney disease.
label: nephrology

text: Patient presents with sudden right-sided weakness and slurred speech. CT confirms ischemic stroke.
label: neurology

text: Pregnant woman at 32 weeks with elevated blood pressure and proteinuria. Diagnosis: preeclampsia.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Patient reports gradual loss of peripheral vision. Intraocular pressure is elevated. Diagnosis: glaucoma.
label: ophthalmology

text: Patient fell and has pain in the hip. X-ray shows femoral neck fracture.
label: orthopedics

text: Patient complains of hearing loss and tinnitus. Audiogram confirms sensorineural hearing loss.
label: otolaryngology

text: Patient reports persistent sadness, loss of interest, and sleep disturbance. Diagnosis: major depressive disorder.
label: psychiatry

text: Patient has chronic cough, wheezing, and reduced FEV1. Diagnosis: asthma.
label: pulmonology

text: Patient presents with joint pain, morning stiffness, and positive rheumatoid factor. Diagnosis: rheumatoid arthritis.
label: rheumatology

text: Patient with exertional dyspnea, lower extremity edema, and echocardiogram showing reduced ejection fraction. Diagnosis: heart failure.
label: cardiology

text: Patient presents with vesicular rash in a dermatomal distribution. Diagnosis: herpes zoster.
label: dermatology

text: Patient with polyuria, polydipsia, and fasting glucose of 180 mg/dL. Diagnosis: type 2 diabetes mellitus.
label: endocrinology

text: Patient with epigastric pain, nausea, and elevated amylase. Diagnosis: acute pancreatitis.
label: gastroenterology

text: Patient with lymphadenopathy, night sweats, and Reed-Sternberg cells on biopsy. Diagnosis: Hodgkin lymphoma.
label: hematology_oncology

text: Patient with fever, neck stiffness, and positive CSF culture for Neisseria meningitidis. Diagnosis: bacterial meningitis.
label: infectious_disease

text: Patient with hematuria, hypertension, and red cell casts in urine. Diagnosis: glomerulonephritis.
label: nephrology

text: Patient with progressive muscle weakness, fasciculations, and EMG showing denervation. Diagnosis: ALS.
label: neurology

text: Woman with irregular vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, and ultrasound showing ovarian cyst. Diagnosis: ovarian cyst.
label: obstetrics_gynecology

text: Patient with sudden painless loss of vision, cherry-red spot on fundus exam. Diagnosis: central retinal artery occlusion.
label: ophthalmology

text: Patient with knee pain after twisting injury, positive McMurray test. Diagnosis: meniscal tear.
label: orthopedics

text: Patient with sore throat, muffled voice, and deviated uvula. Diagnosis: peritonsillar abscess.
label: otolaryngology

text: Patient with auditory hallucinations, disorganized speech, and social withdrawal. Diagnosis: schizophrenia.
label: psychiatry

text: Patient with progressive dyspnea, dry cough, and honeycombing on chest CT. Diagnosis: idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.
label: pulmonology

text: Patient with malar rash, photosensitivity, and positive ANA. Diagnosis: systemic lupus erythematosus.
label: rheumatology
